text:
Luke Barry
Parbold, Wigan
Mobile: 07787 535661
Email: lukebarry1427@gmail.com
A problem-solving driven Process Engineer with an acute attention to detail complimented with a drive to ensure work is punctually completed to an exceptional standard. Along with boosting process efficiencies and enhancing production, I am eager to develop my career whilst simultaneously benefitting the company. I am a self-motivated and hardworking individual with a strong work ethic who is confident completing tasks independently and with others.
University of Hull 2017-2021 – BEng Chemical Engineering: 					Grade achieved: First (74.3%)
Relevant Modules:  Chemical Engineering Design Project (year 3 - 72%), Heat Integration and Process Simulation (year 3 - 87%), Chemical Thermodynamics, Environment and Sustain Luke Barry
Parbold, Wigan
Mobile: 07787 535661
Email: lukebarry1427@gmail.com
A problem-solving driven Process Engineer with an acute attention to detail complimented with a drive to ensure work is punctually completed to an exceptional standard. Along with boosting process efficiencies and enhancing production, I am eager to develop my career whilst simultaneously benefitting the company. I am a self-motivated and hardworking individual with a strong work ethic who is confident completing tasks independently and with others.
University of Hull 2017-2021 – BEng Chemical Engineering: 					Grade achieved: First (74.3%)
Relevant Modules:  Chemical Engineering Design Project (year 3 - 72%), Heat Integration and Process Simulation (year 3 - 87%), Chemical Thermodynamics, Environment and Sustainability (year 3 - 78%).
Highly proficient in the use of software packages such as Microsoft Excel and Visio, MATLAB, ASPEN HYSYS in order to solve complex engineering problems run process simulations.
Profoundly competent in the design and understanding of P&ID’s and PFD’s.
Remarkable mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills, which have been proven to swiftly and efficiently solve issues.
Truly capable of carrying out extensive and complex calculations in the form of mass balances for an entire process.
Essential laboratory health and safety skills completed in 4 university semesters and 6 months of experience in industry through a variety of laboratory sessions. The safe handling and disposal of chemicals, along with report writing skills have been developed.
Currently completing Lean Leadership Certification through BOS (Baxter Operating System)
Baxter Healthcare
Process Engineer – July 2021 to Present Day
Established KPIs and procedures to improve the possibility of predicting out-of-spec material and consequently improving process control measures.
Developed and monitored KPIs to drive continuous improvement of the process.
Determined previously unknown standard process parameters for the ultra-filtration rigs and spray dryers in order to optimise operations and product output.
Composed and developed a new shift report to highlight and accordingly minimise downtime across the process.
Oversaw troubleshooting via data analysis and provided recommendations for corrective actions, which rapidly solved problems and brought minimised downtime to production.
Supported operators in their development of data analysis to react fittingly when a potential significant issue arose.
Thyssenkrupp Aerospace
Sheet Metal Worker – April 2020 to June 2020, May 2019 to September 2019, June 2018 to August 2018
Accelerated the rate at which inspection of parts occurred before they were shipped to customers.
Swiftly adapted to an altered workplace during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Ensured complex orders met their hard deadline via the assistance of the operation of the grindmaster machine.
Supervised new colleagues on standards and health and safety guidelines.
Booths
Customer Assistant – February 2020 to May 2020
Refined customer service skills due to dealing with an abundance of people regularly.
Reduced the amount of time taken for products to be replaced on shelves.
Assisted in sustaining an immaculate and sleek for the store.
BEng Final Year Dissertation Project – Production of Hydrogen
Produced an overall plant design for the production of 80,000 tonnes per year of Hydrogen.
Carried out mass balances along with calculations for the desulphurisation unit dimensions.
Cost calculations were done to determine the feasibility of the operation.
P&ID’s were produced for the six-unit operation of the process, these included features for a safe start-up and shutdown.
Chairperson – Took the role of chairperson for the hydrogen production dissertation project, made major decisions for what route would be taken, reported updates to the group mentor on a weekly basis and kept track of the groups progress and organised group meetings each week.
Team Captain – Captain of the football team in final year of university, coordinated and managed training sessions each week, arranged games with other teams and successfully dealt with large groups of people on a reg

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
